column3: This affects more than the debug.log. Please change the logging instead.\n
@laanwj ah, yes, that might make more sense. Will do.\n

@laanwj Actually the whole thing with nLastTime isn't needed any more is it? This was only needed when nNow was recorded in seconds, but now that it's milliseconds, it's very unlikely there'll be two nNows that are equal. Also, the -1 was added when it was seconds since 1 was the small subtraction possible. Why, when it changes to milliseconds, was the 1 changed to 1000000? 1 is still the smallest
What the code that you removed does is make sure that timestamps are monotonically increasing. NACK on removing it.\n

Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/p4452_c8f1cf56d4d76c75f75f06eef54c8a521807795e/ for binaries and test log.\nThis test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-te
Closing this - if you want to change logging, just change logging.\n
